title: Speed and Ratio Application Problem-Solving Project Through Productive Failure

context.prior_knowledge: Basic arithmetic operations and understanding of proportionality in daily life contexts
context.additional_context: Team-based collaboration and real-life problem-solving projects in smartphone-centric, limited-technology environments.

learning_goals: Learners can creatively derive various representational methods to solve complex speed and ratio problems.
Learners can systematically explain the process of refining problem-solving strategies by reflecting on failure experiences.
Learners can complete projects applying speed and ratio concepts to real-world scenarios (e.g., travel planning, budgeting for purchases).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
